page.title: 14MRS.SUTTON REMEMBERS......
page.content: Mrs. Sutton told us how life was along time ago in Speke...... ...the children did the dusting and polishing when Stocktonwood School was first opened.Mrs.Sutton had classes in her own living room before our school opened. All Saints church hall was the first school in the area. Mrs.Sutton has lived in Speke for 49 years,she is now 82. When new people moved into Speke, they lived in their half-built houses. The Dunlop factory used to be Rootes Securities where bombers were built. Our school might have been an hospital during World War Two. The classrooms were going to be wards and the hall the operating theatre. Army tanks used to train on the fields where I live now!Speke was smaller and quieter in those good,old days! Written by Jon Quick - 4S Stocktonwood Juniors.
